BR_text.BRsummary: Call symbol/nd.smooth_l1 without scalar causing uncaught exception
BR_text.BRdescription:
Call mx.nd.smooth_l1 without scalar parameter will cause mxnet to crash
 <denchmark-code>libc++abi.dylib: terminating with uncaught exception of type std::invalid_argument: stod: no conversion
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
 
 or if you are running standard examples, please provide the commands you have run that lead to the error.
 <denchmark-code>import mxnet.ndarray as nd
 nd.smooth_l1(nd.array([1, 2]))
 </denchmark-code>
 
 <denchmark-h:h2>What have you tried to solve it?</denchmark-h>
 
 Specify scalar will solve it
 <denchmark-code>nd.smooth_l1(nd.array([1, 2]), scalar=1.0)
 </denchmark-code>
 
 However, in the example, the argument is specified as , which is very confusing.
 <denchmark-link:http://mxnet.io/api/python/symbol.html#mxnet.symbol.smooth_l1>http://mxnet.io/api/python/symbol.html#mxnet.symbol.smooth_l1</denchmark-link>
 
 We should add a default value for scalar (1.0), fix the document, and fix the uncaught exception anyway
